snippets.quote: Specifically, I work within process sciences.
snippets.contextBefore:
[Speaker 4607870032831329751]: okay.
[Speaker 4607870032831329751]: Alright.
[Speaker 4607870032831329751]: So maybe to get us started, can you tell me a little bit about your current role and how presentations fit into your day to day job?
[Speaker 4014371014756033807]: Of course.
[Speaker 4014371014756033807]: Yeah.
[Speaker 4014371014756033807]: So I work at regeneron in our iops division which is our manufacturing site.
[Speaker 4014371014756033807]:
snippets.contextAfter:
[Speaker 4014371014756033807]: So if you're familiar with like an emsat team, kind of we in a sense act as let's call it tech support for manufacturing in a very kind of streamlined way to call it.
[Speaker 4014371014756033807]: Whenever there are types of investigations around a specific engineering run or a… deeper understanding of our process, a process scientist looks into those… roles for the company.
[Speaker 4014371014756033807]: So specifically my role I'm in upstream investigations and within my role, I evaluate new technology.
[Speaker 4014371014756033807]: So anything that would be new in terms of the industry that makes manufacturing more streamlined, acts as a new process analytical tool, new types of assays, things to help improve our understanding not only of our process but in terms of, you know, how to improve or optimize our process or also improve engineering runs.
[Speaker 4014371014756033807]: We will evaluate new technology that comes out either internally or als...
